About Me

Hi, my name is Girish, a senior year Information Technology undergrad at Manipal Institute of Technology. My research interests lie in the Cognitive Science and Learning Theory. I have worked with a range of different languages and frameworks and I am always looking for opportunities to work with something new. The things that I currently have the most experience working with are: Javascript, Angular Java, Python, Android, Swift, and Matlab.

A proud Tamilian hailing from Madurai, I spend my leisure time cycling to new destinations or playing the violin.

Education

Manipal Institute of Technology

B Tech Information Technology

2016 - PRESENT

Senior year undergraduate student, majoring in Information Technology, with a CGPA of 8.31 and a bag full of experiences in organising and managing college fests to technical developments through working in teams like SolarMobil and the Editorial Board.

While at Manipal I spent a lot of my free time with the Cycling society. I spent 2 years on the committee as a treasurer. During this time I initiated a Cyclothon event which has then gone on to become an annual event in Manipal.

When I'm Not Programming

When I’m not at my desk I am very active and spend most of my time outdoors. I do a lot a sports such as road cycling, and running as well as trying to make time for things like playing some basketball and football. Since my time at Uni I have become a very keen marathoner. In 2018 I competed in my first half-marathon and completed it in sub 2 hours. I play the violin, though mainly classical I try out covers now and then.

Finally during the rest of my free time you will either find me working on my bikes, playing at one of Manipal’s basketball courts or down the football field.
